newsitem.title: UK: BTR to buy GEC-Alsthom unit.
newsitem.headline: BTR to buy GEC-Alsthom unit.

text.p: British industrial holdings company BTR Plc said on Thursday it agreed to buy Parvex from GEC-Alsthom NV and sell its Mirrless Blackstone unit to the joint venture company.
BTR said Parvex would enhance its Brook Hansen industrial motors and gear drives unit, while the Mirrlees sale completed its exit from diesel engine manufacturing.
Financial terms of the deal were not disclosed.
Parvex, which had sales of 27 million stg last year, is a maker of servomotors and numerical control devices.
Mirrlees, a maker of engines for electrical power generation, had sales of 84 million stg last year.
GEC-Alsthom is a joint venture of Britain's General Electric Co Plc and France's Alcatel Alsthom.
Earlier on Wednesday, BTR warned its first-half operating profit would be hurt by sterling's strength and weakness in key markets.
BTR's shares sank 25.5p to 242 by 0820 GMT. -- London Newsroom +44 171 542 7717
